subject: Critical Thinking
title: Conditional Probability: When Context Changes Everything
description: A quick, practical guide to Conditional Probability: When Context Changes Everything.

hook.text: The probability of being hit by lightning is 1 in 500,000. But if you're standing in an open field during a storm?

buildup.text: Conditional probability: the likelihood of an event GIVEN that another event has occurred. Context changes the math.

discovery.text: P(A|B): the probability of A given B. It's not the same as P(B|A). Confusing them is a common and dangerous error.

twist.text: The prosecutor's fallacy: P(evidence|innocent) ‚â† P(innocent|evidence). Rare evidence doesn't mean rare innocence.

climax.text: Every time someone says 'the odds are X,' ask: 'Given what conditions?' Without context, probabilities are meaningless.

punchline.text: Probability without context is just a number. Context is everything.
